pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:0.5: 61. The training rule on pregnant women
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.2: the nuns gave the full ordination to a woman who was pregnant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.5: “Give almsfood to the nun. She’s carrying a heavy burden.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.7: “How can the nuns give the full ordination to a woman who is pregnant?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.8: The nuns heard the complaints of those people
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.9: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.10: “How can nuns give the full ordination to a woman who is pregnant?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.11: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.14: “… How can the nuns give the full ordination to a woman who is pregnant?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.15: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.16: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.17: ‘If a nun gives the full ordination to a woman who is pregnant, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.9: If, intending to give the full ordination, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a boundary, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.10: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.11: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.12: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.13: the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.1: If she is pregnant, and she perceives her as pregnant, and she gives her the full ordination, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.2: If she is pregnant, but she is unsure if she is, and she gives her the full ordination, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.3: If she is pregnant, but she does not perceive her as pregnant, and she gives her the full ordination, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.4: If she is not pregnant, but she perceives her as pregnant, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.5: If she is not pregnant, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.6: If she is not pregnant, and she does not perceive her as pregnant, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.2: if she is pregnant, but she does not perceive her as pregnant, and she gives her the full ordination;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.3: if she is not pregnant, and she does not perceive her as pregnant, and she gives her the full ordination;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.6: The first training rule is finished.
